column4: im making a makefile for a school assignment. how do i prevent anything being sent to standard output?
is that the only way?
and will EVERY unix machine have /dev/hull?
Every POSIX-compliant OS will have /dev/null
what command are you trying to run?
i am compiling a java class javac -classpath $(PATHH) -Xlint $<
and where is the /dev/null coming from?
javac -classpath $(PATHH) -Xlint $< >> /dev/null
shouldn't matter.
there is no last slash on that.
what's the output of "file /dev/null"
you ARE running Linux, yes? o__O
that's different! Which is it?!
what's the output of    echo "foobar" > /dev/null
Good. Now what's the output of your command with > /dev/null
it still outputs to the screen
what about 2> /dev/null
> means "standard output". 2> means "error output"
the compiler was printing those warnings to standard error rather than standard out
many people on here are! Everyone has to start somewhere :)
why don't you write code that doesn't generate warnings? :)
